release.description: Using ep-util to mine enzyme regulation text for inhibitors and activators.
release.action: Updated to latest versions of ep-util, ep-domain and mega-mapper.
Using ep-util to text-mine UniProt for activators and inhibitors, with proper regular expressions. The old methods here are now deprecated and point to ep-util actually.
Removed tests from Transformer, as the methods parsing text for inhibitors/activators have moved to EPUtil.
Closing mega-mapper after using it avoids more than likely problems (too many open cursors).

Now this module uses mega-mapper (added dependency) to retrieve PDB xrefs from there and replace the ones coming from UniProt, which include theoretical models. The previous solution was buggy, as it retrieved PDB xrefs for all of the orthologs, mixing them and resulting sometimes in the wrong thumbnail being displayed.
Updated to latest version of parent pom file (move to GitHub), ep-domain, ep-util, uniprotjapi - to use always the latest release - and junit.
